Detailed Description

AHCAL implementation of Mapper class.

invalid cells and exception handling
Most functions throw a CALICE::BadDataException if an invalid combination or ID is queried. Not all invalid combinations will be detected by all commands, depending on the necessary coordinate transformations in the command. E.g.: When querying the module from a Mokka cell ID, only K is extracted from the ID. If no module exists for this K an exception is thrown. But there will be no exception thrown if K is valid but I and J belong to a channel which does not exist in this module.
The protected getIndexFunctions do not throw exceptions to allow a fast lookup of the index. Invalid channels are signalled with return value maxIndex+1.
Some functions have a second version that does a full check if the ID is valid without throwing an exception.
Author:
Benjamin.Lutz@desy.de
Version:
0.3
Date:
January 2010

Member Function Documentation

void CALICE::AhcMapper::fill ( const lcio::LCCollection *  moduleDescriptionCol,
const lcio::LCCollection *  moduleConnectionCol 
) [inline]

fills all necessary mapping information

Module layout types are set from moduleDescription (chip,channel to I,J,K & size) Module connections are set from moduleConnection (crate, slot, fe to module)

Old settings are cleared before new are set.

Parameters:
[in] moduleDescriptionCol LCGenericObject collection of ModuleDescription type
[in] moduleConnectionCol LCGenericObject collection of ModuleConnection type

void CALICE::AhcMapper::fillModuleDescription ( const lcio::LCCollection *  col  )  [private]

sets the module layout information in the class, module connection information will be invalidated

The internal layout of modules, like channel to I,J,K and cell sizes are set.

Warning:
module connection information will be invalidated, fillModuleConnection has to be called aftwards
Parameters:
[in] col LCGenericObject collection of ModuleDescription type

int CALICE::AhcMapper::getCellIDOfIndex ( unsigned int  index  )  const [inline, protected, virtual]

get the cell ID of a certain compact index

Warning:
This cell ID will only contain information about I, J and K. If the encoding string contains additional fields this will have value 0.
See also:
setCellIDencoding
Returns:
(Mokka) cell ID
